input: What does Section 96 of the IPC define?
target: Section 96 provides that nothing is an offense if it is done in the exercise of the right of private defense.

input: Does Section 96 justify all acts of private defense?
target: Yes, if the act is done within the limits of private defense, it is not an offense under Section 96.

input: What is an example of immunity under Section 96?
target: Defending oneself against an armed attacker is protected under Section 96.

input: Does Section 96 apply to excessive use of force?
target: No, excessive use of force beyond the necessity of defense is not protected.

input: What is the significance of Section 96?
target: Section 96 safeguards individuals defending themselves or others from unlawful attacks.
